Articles.Content:
Can you see what it is ?

![G8GetYi.png](http://i.imgur.com/G8GetYi.png)

![:D](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_cheesy.gif)

For those who want to fly it I added the craftfile:

[https://www.dropbox.com/s/xdg08u3tkw391he/GiM%2015.craft?dl=0](https://www.dropbox.com/s/xdg08u3tkw391he/GiM%2015.craft?dl=0)

**Edited <time datetime="2015-06-22T22:00:15Z" title="06/22/2015 10:00  PM" data-short="9 yr">June 22, 2015</time> by Triop**

The cockpit's fine. It's the *rest of the plane* that's on backwards!

\*mind blown\*
I've had jet parts do the same thing to me, engines flipping and such.

That is actually genuinely hilarious. XD

You gotta dump that shot in here later: [http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/124242-Do-you-have-a-screenshot-that-makes-you-laugh-every-time](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/124242-Do-you-have-a-screenshot-that-makes-you-laugh-every-time)
well if you invert the controls ( may not the roll) it should still fly just fine.

> 
> The cockpit's fine. It's the *rest of the plane* that's on backwards!
> \*mind blown\*

See, this is the kind of person that NASA needs on their payroll.
Always include a docking port on the "front" of the craft... that way if your perspective is backwards, you can just right-click the docking port and click "control from here."

That's so you can see where you've been.

If I didn't know better, I'd also say it looks like you're missing a wing lol.
There are no control surfaces on the wings.

> 
> That's so you can see where you've been.
> If I didn't know better, I'd also say it looks like you're missing a wing lol.

You mean like this:

![fdETJd9.png](http://i.imgur.com/fdETJd9.png)

Edit: watch the navball ![:cool:](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_cool.gif)

**Edited <time datetime="2015-06-23T04:03:30Z" title="06/23/2015 04:03  AM" data-short="9 yr">June 23, 2015</time> by Triop**

I recently built, and have been flying quite a bit because it's awesome, a small two-seater spacecraft with a forward-facing inline cockpit for the pilot and a rear-facing inline cockpit for the harpoon gun operator (using the winch and harpoon from Kerbal Attachment System). IVA view makes it easier to aim the harpoon. It's remarkably useful for towing debris out of orbit.

Behold... the H-Wing.

![screenshot192.png](https://lh3.googleusercontent.com/-fD1lQP-pAHg/VYjYy8totdI/AAAAAAAABe4/ECMuU1CH-ZE/s800/screenshot192.png)

![screenshot200.png](https://lh3.googleusercontent.com/-xFGoxDr8MV0/VYjY0ArJRdI/AAAAAAAABfA/TjuhlDszd5Q/s800/screenshot200.png)

backwards cockpit and your using the old wheesly model.

Also, why do the inline Mk1s look so weird in these photos? They have a weird bump and a black line that are not present in my game. Was there an update or something? Whats the deal there?

**Edited <time datetime="2015-12-25T06:45:48Z" title="12/25/2015 06:45  AM" data-short="8 yr">December 25, 2015</time> by nosirrbro**

> backwards cockpit and your using the old wheesly model.

> Also, why do the inline Mk1s look so weird in these photos? They have a weird bump and a black line that are not present in my game. Was there an update or something? Whats the deal there?

See the dates: These are the old model, before the update.
